name: understudied
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
An understudied subject has not been studied as much as it should be or as much as you would expect: The terrapin is a surprisingly understudied species. Heart disease in women has been understudied for years.
More examplesFewer examplesDHEA (dehydroepiandrosterone) is an understudied hormone.Until now, the topic of absentee ballots has been understudied and underanalyzed.This protein has been linked to a rare and understudied allergy to maize.The book shines a new light onto an understudied part of her art."People in the African American community suffer worse disease at about every level," Thornburg says. "It's terribly understudied."
